Comment: As we have here multiple 1:n relations we could model that to reduce duplicated entries, but I think to ease the process we can have multiple duplicated entries, e.g. pipelines across multuple donors.

Submittion.Comment: Main Information about submission and submitter.
Submittion.labName: Institute für Humangenetik am Klinikum rechts der Isar

Donors.Comment: We can have multiple donors, e.g. index patient plus family members and each with a different consent.
Donors.researchConsent: MII Consent FHIR Resource ID ToDo XXX

LabData.Comment: All information about the lab data. We could have multiple tissues or technologies, e.g. blood and tumor or DNA and RNA.
LabData.targetRegionFile: What do we put here? I advocate for the actuall file. A file path does not help here. If file, I would go with same info as in SequenceData
LabData.libraryPrepkit: Agilent SureSelect Human All Exon V6

SequenceData.Comment: The pipeline should be the same for one LabData entity but we can have multiple files.
